title: Prasada, the Gracious Gift, in Contemporary and Classical South Asia
abstract: Journal Article Prasāda, the Gracious Gift, in Contemporary and Classical South Asia Get access Andrea Marion Pinkney Andrea Marion Pinkney * *Andrea Marion Pinkney, Faculty of Religious Studies, McGill University, Montréal, Canada. E-mail: andrea.pinkney@mcgill.ca. The first version of this paper was presented in 2006 at the American Academy of Religion Annual Meeting in Washington, DC, on a panel co-organized with Anne Murphy (University of British Columbia) and a shorter version was published as "Prasāda in Contemporary and Classical Contexts," in Śrīnidhiḥ: Professor Shrikant Bahulkar's Gratitude Volume, ed. Ambarish Vasant Khare, Shripad G. Bhat, and Shilpa Sumant, Pune, Samvidya Institute (2009), 474–496. I would like to express my sincere thanks to the editors of Śrīnidhiḥ for their kind permission to use parts of that essay here. Thank you to Andrea Acri, Shrikant Bahulkar, Carla Bellamy, John Stratton Hawley, Pushpa Kale, Rachel Fell McDermott, Anne Murphy, Christian Novetzke, Roy Tzohar, Andy Rotman, Kiran A. Shinde, Isaac Souweine, Gary Tubb, A.R. Venkatachalapathy, and the anonymous reviewers of the JAAR for their contributions in improving this article.
